meanings.definition: To catch up with and pass by (someone or something) in motion.
meanings.sent1: The speedy rabbit overtook the slow turtle in the race.
meanings.sent2: The car overtook the bicycle on the road.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky cat overtook the unsuspecting mouse in the chase.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun overtook the darkness of the night.
meanings.sent5: The wind overtook the leaves, swirling them into a dance.

meanings.definition: To come upon suddenly or unexpectedly.
meanings.sent1: The storm clouds overtook the sunny sky.
meanings.sent2: The feeling of exhaustion overtook him after a long day.
meanings.sent3: Laughter overtook the serious meeting, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: A sense of calm overtook her as she listened to the soothing music.
meanings.sent5: Excitement overtook the crowd as the fireworks lit up the sky.

meanings.definition: To move past or beyond (someone or something) in a race or competition.
meanings.sent1: The athlete overtook his rival just before the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The student overtook his classmates in the spelling bee.
meanings.sent3: The aroma of freshly baked cookies overtook the entire house.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of pride overtook her as she crossed the marathon finish line.
meanings.sent5: The cheers of the fans overtook the noise of the stadium.
